message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about chemical reactions. When bleach and vinegar are mixed together, they create a chemical reaction that produces chlorine gas and water. This reaction is commonly known as the bleach vinegar combo solution. Option (A) is incorrect because pouring soda into milk does not cause a chemical reaction. Option (B) is also incorrect because putting vinegar in a bowl does not result in a chemical reaction. Option (D) is incorrect because pouring baking soda out of a box by itself does not cause a chemical reaction.

This question requires knowledge about chemical reactions and the properties of the substances listed. Option (C) is the correct answer because mixing bleach and vinegar creates a chemical reaction that produces chlorine gas. Option (A) is incorrect because pouring soda into milk will not create a chemical reaction, only a mixing of the two substances. Option (B) is incorrect because putting vinegar in a bowl alone will not cause a chemical reaction. Option (D) is incorrect because pouring baking soda out of a box is a physical change, not a chemical reaction.

Option (D) may cause a physical reaction, such as the baking soda expanding, but it is not a chemical reaction.
